tool.name: OGS: ExtractSurface
tool.description: Galaxy wrapper for the OGS utility 'ExtractSurface'.
tool.command: for i in $mesh_input_file; do if [ "$i" != "None" ] && [ ! -e "$(basename $i)" ]; then ln -s "$i" "$(basename $i)"; fi; done; ExtractSurface $ascii_output #if str($angle).strip() != 'None' and str($angle).strip() != '': --angle '$angle' #end if #if str($z_component).strip() != 'None' and str($z_component).strip() != '': --z-component '$z_component' #end if #if str($y_component).strip() != 'None' and str($y_component).strip() != '': --y-component '$y_component' #end if #if str($x_component).strip() != 'None' and str($x_component).strip() != '': --x-component '$x_component' #end if --mesh-input-file '$mesh_input_file.element_identifier' --mesh-output-file output_1.vtu

param.name: ascii_output
param.label: ascii output
param.help: If the switch is set use ascii instead of binary format for data in the vtu output.

param.name: angle
param.label: angle
param.help: tolerated angle (in degrees) between given normal and element normal, (min = 0), (max = 360)

param.name: mesh_input_file
param.label: mesh input file
param.help: Input (.vtu). the file containing the input mesh

tool.help: This tool runs the **ExtractSurface** utility from the OpenGeoSys suite.
